1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Episode 2 marks the start of BPM, and we feature toy & pop store Kidrobot, Ta Bom -- a Brazilian family-run food truck -- New Balance sneakers, and stylist Taylor Jacobson and her fashion insight.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: In episode 3, we get into BlackMarket apparel, WeWOOD watches, and the Mighty Boba food truck.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Episode 4 raves about denim from Kasil Jeans, the Boom Bag -- a luggage bag with built-in speakers -- and PF Flyers, a shoe brand started by BF Goodrich.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: In this episode, we rave about fashion designer Catherine Malandrino and her creations, brass knuckle ring mugs, and ion watches.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: This episodes raves about the Mighty Wallet and Kombucha drinks. YouTube artist David Choi joins as guest.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: We rave about Bella Hair, the book "Korea Unmasked," and designer Peter Hong of My Ninja! Clothing joins as guest.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: In this episode, we rave about how awesome boxing is as a workout, and Grant Hooks joins in as guest.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Funny man Bobby Lee is our guest for this episode, and we rave about the In Residence apparel store and the Master Cleanse diet.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: We rave about Bibigo, a Korean restaurant chain specializing in Bibimbap. We also include our thoughts on button makers and the Canon Rebel T2i digital camera.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Entertainment does some fantastic work as a voice-over studio, and we look into their space. We also talk about livening up a space with wall accents, and we welcome Kollaboration guests Roy Choi, Christine Kim, and Rina Lee.

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Def Jam artist Mann, and Rich Bao of Neoclassics are our guests for this episode. We also give you the scoop on L.A.'s boxing team, the Matadors.

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: We rave about boba shop Boba Loca, shake weights, and Richard Zoglin's book "Comedy at the Edge."

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: This episode raves about Cham Korean Bistro, Klean Kanteen stainless steel bottles, mugs, and cups, and Kaba Modern dancer Mike Song (of America's Best Dance Crew fame) joins in as guest.

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: We rave about OK Apparel, Converse All Star's Undefeated sneakers, and Chester Berry of Complex Magazine joins us as guest.

26.title: Episode #1.26
26.plot: Yvonne talks about J-Pop and L.A. pop culture stores, PK talks about the Hipstagram app, and singer/songwriter Dawen joins as guest.

27.title: Episode #1.27
27.plot: Episode 26 visits the Mohawk General Store in Los Angeles, a multi-store owned by husband and wife duo Kevin and Bo Carney. Yvonne raves about photo editing website Picnik.com, and PK raves about Jawbone's Jambox, a portable Bluetooth speaker.

28.title: Episode #1.28
28.plot: Episode 28 invites Chinese American Congresswoman Judy Chu, and hosts Yvonne and PK rave about Kalbi Burger and Jawbone's latest Bluetooth headsets, the ERA and ICON.

29.title: Episode #1.29
29.plot: Episode 29 introduces The Ave., a custom graphics and apparel shop in Venice Beach, California. Yvonne raves about online radio website, Pandora.com. Musical guest DJ Neil Armstrong, who has spun for the likes of Jay-Z and President Obama, also joins in on this episode.

30.title: Episode #1.30
30.plot: Episode 30 brings the back-story on Soompi.com, one of the original websites for Asian pop entertainment and fashion. Yvonne raves about the Wine Aerator, and PK discusses "Fallin' Up," the new autobiography by Taboo, member of The Black Eyed Peas.

31.title: Episode #1.31
31.plot: Episode 31 introduces Molla Space (of MollaSpace.com), a lifestyle shop by collective designers. PK and Yvonne talk about Far East Movement and rave about the website, StuffKoreanMomsLike.blogspot.com.

32.title: Episode #1.32
32.plot: PK raves about Wacko, a pop culture and kitsch emporium, and Yvonne discusses Freehands, a glove featuring fold-back index finger and thumb tips to allow touchscreen device use. Actor Steven Yeun from "The Walking Dead" joins as guest.

33.title: Episode #1.33
33.plot: In Episode 33, Yvonne raves about Cailyn Cosmetic's products, and P.K. raves about the one internet forum all Los Angeles Clippers fans should use. Comedian Ian Edwards appears as guest.

34.title: Episode #1.34
34.plot: Episode 34 visits the Meltdown Comics and Collectibles store in Los Angeles, and Yvonne talks about the benefits of Thera Cane, an ergonomically designed massage stick. Phil Yu from the blog.AngryAsianMan.com joins as guest.

35.title: Episode #1.35
35.plot: All about food and fitness as we rave about Dine L.A., the Wii Fit Hula Hoop, and Chef Roy Choi's restaurant, A-Frame.

36.title: Episode #1.36
36.plot: Episode 136 invites musical duo Ken Oak and Ed Gorski, and Yvonne raves about the Ray Ban "Aviator" sunglasses and "Snooki Slippers."

37.title: Episode #1.37
37.plot: Episode 37 interviews NFL star Hines Ward, and PK raves about Soundwagon, the world's smallest portable vinyl record player, while Yvonne raves about Shiseido's cult-favorite sunblock.

38.title: Episode #1.38
38.plot: Episode 38 invites singer/songwriter Sam Geunjin Kang, PK visits the LA Asian Film Festival, and Yvonne raves about MaxandChloe.com, an online jewelry retailer.

39.title: Episode #1.39
39.plot: This exciting episode features Korean-American hip-hop artist Dumbfoundead, and also includes an interview with actor John Cho at the LA Asian Film Festival. Yvonne also raves about the Magic Eraser.

40.title: Episode #1.40
40.plot: Episode 40 is a fun one, showing a different side of Mnet with a staff-made lip dub video to the music video "Fly Like a G6" by Far East Movement. Yvonne raves about Beats by Dre headphones, and Kauila Barber, makeup artist to the stars, joins in as guest.

41.title: Episode #1.41
41.plot: Episode 41 includes an interview with actor Aaron Yoo at the LA Asian Film Festival, Yvonne raves about Sally Hansen's nail products, and PK raves about the Amazon Kindle.

42.title: Episode #1.42
42.plot: This episode features Rocco's Italian Kitchen, the Nikon Coolpix camera, and Justin Rivera, a comedian/magician.

43.title: Episode #1.43
43.plot: This episode includes as interview with comedian and actor Steve Park, Yvonne raves about external hard drives, and PK raves about the book, "How Koreans Talk - Funny Expressions."

44.title: Episode #1.44
44.plot: It's all about hats and shoes as we look into Hall of Fame caps and Sergio Rossi heels. Comedian Johnny Sanchez is invited as guest.

45.title: Episode #1.45
45.plot: We visit the Derringer Bicycle Shop, rave about NeatDesk's scanner and organizer, and Yvonne raves about Korean cosmetic brand Charmzone's Exfoliator Cream.

46.title: Episode #1.46
46.plot: Professional dancer and choreographer to the stars Shaun Evaristo joins as this episode's special guest, and Yvonne raves about Magic Bullet blenders while PK raves about DJ equipment by Turntable Lab.

47.title: Episode #1.47
47.plot: We interview Chuck Mitsui at the LA Asian Film Festival about his film "One Kine Day," and rave about skateboard bibles and decks.

48.title: Episode #1.48
48.plot: We visit Venice Beach and PK plays with the Kodak PLAYSPORT camera while Yvonne raves about Clarisonic's new skin care technology.

49.title: Episode #1.49
49.plot: We talk about Ken Jeong and Justin Bartha from the "Hangover 2," and PK raves about Reef sandals and the 80's boombox.

50.title: Episode #1.50
50.plot: We invite Dennet Oyanguren, creative director and founder of Evil Goods, rave about Icon motorcycle gear, and look into interesting things happening this summer at the bar of Hotel Erwin in Venice Beach.

51.title: Episode #1.51
51.plot: We talk about Asian American actress Jamie Chung, how to make "patbingsu" -- a refreshing, Korean, summer dessert -- and the Joos Orange Solar charger.

52.title: Episode #1.52
52.plot: PK raves about the Wakemate, an electronic device with sensors to monitor the sleep state and facilitate waking up in the mornings. Yvonne raves about Bann Restaurant, a smoke-free, modern Korean BBQ restaurant, and Kyle, an Mnet intern raves about the Rabito bunny iPhone stand and case.

53.title: Episode #1.53
53.plot: Iron Chef America host and actor in the "Brotherhood of the Wolf," Mark Dacascos, is our guest in this episode. PK raves about Rif, a Los Angeles shoe boutique, and Yvonne raves about Ecoist handbags made from recycled materials.

54.title: Episode #1.54
54.plot: Episode 54 talks about our nation's capital, Washington D.C. and Yvonne raves about eco-friendly aluminum water bottles. Actor Randall Park joins as guest.

55.title: Episode #1.55
55.plot: PK talks about the book "The Comedy Bible," we try out Orochon Ramen House's food challenge, and we rave about the Nintendo 3DS.

56.title: Episode #1.56
56.plot: PK raves about the Jim Rohn Newsletter, Yvonne raves about Vintage Barbie, and comedian Vince Royale joins as guest.

57.title: Episode #1.57
57.plot: This episodes raves about Royal T, a Japanese cafe with a cosplay concept. Yvonne raves about some heels, and Julie teaches us how to make the Korean dish Dduk Bok Gi.

58.title: Episode #1.58
58.plot: PK raves about the book "Pop Goes Korea," Yvonne raves about vintage G.I. Joe action figures, and comedian KT Tatara joins as guest.

59.title: Episode #1.59
59.plot: PK invites guest comedian Kevin Shea, and we rave about Tekken, a new 3D gaming and movie experience. The BPM staff also reveal childhood photos of themselves share their stories of how they got their scars.

61.title: Episode #1.61
61.plot: We rave about City Tavern in Culver City, Yvonne raves about facial masks, and PK raves about the book, "The Social Media Bible."

62.title: Episode #1.62
62.plot: YouTube star Dan Matthews (DANakaDAN) and Olivia Ti join as guests, and we discuss culture shock, dry shampoo, and more childhood scars.

63.title: Episode #1.63
63.plot: We discuss LA Brakeless, a Los Angeles-based custom bike shop, the Muffuletta sandwich, and the nuTsie music download app.

64.title: Episode #1.64
64.plot: We get surfing lessons in this episode, Yvonne discusses the health benefits of Korean citron tea, and we look into printable posters of Facebook friends.

65.title: Episode #1.65
65.plot: Electro-pop band IAMMEDIC joins as musical guest, we discuss the culture shock in women's fashion, and PK fave raves about the book, "I'm Dying Up Here: Heartbreak and High Times in Stand-Up Comedy's Golden Era" by William Knoedelseder.

66.title: Episode #1.66
66.plot: Guest comedian Monrock is invited, and we discuss the E3 game convention and misspelled tattoos.

67.title: Episode #1.67
67.plot: Comedian and actress Jade Catta-Preta joins as this episode's guest, and we discuss even more of the BPM staff's childhood scars.

68.title: Episode #1.68
68.plot: Comedy Central's Darren Carter is this episode's guest, and we roll our eyes over misspelled signs. Yvonne raves about Nylon Magazine.

69.title: Episode #1.69
69.plot: Music group Three Strykes is the guest for this episode. Yvonne raves about the Nike+ and iPod fitness technology, and PK raves about Kickstart.org, a non-profit website helping create fundraisers for good causes.

70.title: Episode #1.70
70.plot: Comedian Walter Hong, and Danny Choo, host of "Culture Japan," are our guests for this episode. Yvonne raves about the Rodgers and Hammerstein musical "Flower Drum Song," the first Asian American English-speaking musical of its kind.

71.title: Episode #1.71
71.plot: It's all about San Francisco in this episode as we discover NEW PEOPLE, San Francisco's Japanese shopping and entertainment building located in the heart of historic Japantown. We also visit the Slanted Door, a Vietnamese restaurant using organic produce and ecologically farmed meat. Marja Vongerichten of the Kimchi Chronicles joins us as guest.

72.title: Episode #1.72
72.plot: This episode raves about clothing line Johnny Cupcakes and Sanrio skateboards. Southern California's electronic band, the Speaker Junkies, also visit as guests for the day.

73.title: Episode #1.73
73.plot: The episode raves about CELTX, media pre-production software designed for creating and organizing media projects like screenplays, films, videos, and others. PK raves about the motivational self-help book, "The Magic of Thinking Big" by Dr. David J. Schwartz.

74.title: Episode #1.74
74.plot: Aiko Tanaka is our guest for this episode, and we rave about MOCA's Red Sticker Campaign. We also let you in on how to execute the perfect pushup and pull-up.

75.title: Episode #1.75
75.plot: Jamie Masada, founder of the Laugh Factory is our guest for this episode. We also rave about Moonshine Jewelry and the Cinemin Swivel Projector, a portable, mini, media projector.

76.title: Episode #1.76
76.plot: We fave rave about actor, director, and producer, Michael Rapaport, and we also fave rave about the GoPro cameras and the GoPro app.

77.title: Episode #1.77
77.plot: On this episode, Julie talks about "The Cove," a documentary on dolphin slaughtering. Our hosts also talk about their childhood scars, and singer-songwriters Jane Lui and Goh Nakamura are our guests for this episode.

78.title: Episode #1.78
78.plot: We have Dan Gabriel, a comedian of Comedy Central, as our guest for this episode. We also fave rave about eco-friendly electric scooters and PopKiller, a Japanese pop culture apparel and collectibles boutique chain with locations in the Los Angeles area.

79.title: Episode #1.79
79.plot: We rave about Lucky Peach Magazine and Groceries Apparel -- a clothing line reminiscent of American Apparel. For our guests, we have the girls of Blush, an international Asian-American pop girl group based in Los Angeles.

80.title: Episode #1.80
80.plot: Greg Grunberg of Heroes is our guest for this show. We also teach Yvonne the guitar using the iPhone app 'Tuning Your Guitar.' PK also lets us in on a little treat with a performance of a remixed Matchbox 20 song.

81.title: Episode #1.81
81.plot: On this episode, we have MTV's 'America's Best Dance Crew' champion and YouTube star, Victor Kim. We also rave about trendy street-wear brand 'Crooks & Castles' along with a weird toys brand.

82.title: Episode #1.82
82.plot: Yvonne raves about the iHome and its functionality as portable speakers. Our guest is Kyle Turley, former NFL Player and current country music recording artist.

83.title: Episode #1.83
83.plot: R&B star Amerie is our guest for this episode, and Yvonne raves about a local basketball dunk contest.

84.title: Episode #1.84
84.plot: This episode features a novel by the Korean playwright Kyung-Sook Shin called "Please Look After Mom." Yvonne raves about the Canon Photo Printer, and YouTube singer Jennifer Chung joins in as guest.

85.title: Episode #1.85
85.plot: We have two special guests on this episode. First is Yvonne's guest, creator of comic strip "Angry Little Girls," Lela Lee. Our second guest is PK's pick, Los Angeles-based independent hip-hop group, "Tier 2."

86.title: Episode #1.86
86.plot: Joey Guila and the men of Asian-American R&B/Hip-Hop trio, Aziatix, are our guests for this episode.

87.title: Episode #1.87
87.plot: YouTube singer/songwriter, Clara Chung, is our guest. PK provides a history lesson on the Los Angeles Dodgers, and Yvonne gives us the rundown of the Anime Expo.

88.title: Episode #1.88
88.plot: Comedian and television host Angie Greenup is our guest. PK also gives us a player profile on Andre Ethier of the Los Angeles Dodgers. Yvonne's rave of the day is on the bestselling novel, "The Help," by Kathryn Stockett.

89.title: Episode #1.89
89.plot: Comedian, tattoo artist, and skateboarder George Wang, along with comedian Quinn Dahle, are our guests. PK gives us another player profile on Matt Kemp of the Los Angeles Dodgers.

90.title: Episode #1.90
90.plot: Christina Lee, host of Mnet America's 'Short Notice,' is our guest. PK does yet another player profile on Dodgers star Tony Gwynn Jr.. The hosts also interview music artists Dev and the Cataracs.

91.title: Episode #1.91
91.plot: YouTube singer Paul Kim is our guest. PK gives us a profile on James Loney of the Los Angeles Dodgers. And what on earth is "planking" and "owling?" Yvonne yearns to find out.

92.title: Episode #1.92
92.plot: PK does a profile rundown of Steve Garvey of the Los Angeles Dodgers. Koreatown rapper Dumbfoundead is our guest.

93.title: Episode #1.93
93.plot: This episode's guest is Leonardo Nam, actor in the film, "The Perfect Score." PK also looks into 'Capoeira Brasil,' a capoeira martial arts studio.

94.title: Episode #1.94
94.plot: Our guests for this episode are Yuri Tag of Kaba Modern, and the Beatards, a New York and LA-based hip-hop music group.

95.title: Episode #1.95
95.plot: Korean American rapper Jacob Paek, better known as IZ, serves as this episode's guest. We also fave rave about KillSpencer, a men's bag and pack shop that specializes in custom, handcrafted, leather products.
